page.title: 09RELIGIONS
page.content: The area is predominantly Christian with a higher than usual proportion of Roman Catholics. The R.C. churches still have substantial regular congregations inspite of there being many lapsed members. The C of E Churches have moderate congregations, but many parishioners no longer attend. Baptist and Congregationalist Churches can be found in this area with Gospel Hall and Spiritualist groups also. The Salvation Army is represented in moderate premises,its child orientated activities attract many local children. The Methodist Churches are now combined and have become the United Reformed Church. The ethnic communities are served by a Mosque at South Shields which was rebuilt in 1971.
